Class Landscape

  • java.lang.Object
    • Landscape

  • public class Landscape
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the randomly generated landscape of the LunarX game.
    Version:
    May 23, 2016
    Author:
    Andrew Kou and Tejasvi Kothapalli, Period: 3, APCS Final Project: LunarX, Sources: None

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Landscape(int w, int max, int min, int sMax, int change, int numberOfZones)
      Initializes the fields and assigns randomly generated coordinates that are continuous and have flat areas for the landing point.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void drawLandscape(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Draws the landscape using the xCoords and yCoords.
      int[] getCoordinates()
      Gets the coordinates of the landscape terrain.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,LandingPoint> getLandingPoints()
      Gets the map in which the X-coordinate of the landing platforms corresponds to the LandingPoint object.
      java.awt.Polygon getLandscapePolygon()
      Gets the landscape polygon shape.
      int getMaxHeight()
      Gets the maximum height of any point in the terrain of the landscape.
      int getMinHeight()
      Gets the minimum height of any point in the terrain of the landscape.
      int getWidth()
      Gets the width of the landscape.
      double[] getXDoubleValues()
      This returns the double representation of the x values
      double[] getYDoubleValues()
      This returns the double representation of the y values
      int getZoneWidth()
      Gets the width of the zone in which a single landing platform exists.
      void putPointValues(java.awt.Graphics g, int frameNums)
      This places the point values on the GUI

    • Constructor Detail

      • Landscape

        public Landscape(int w,
         int max,
         int min,
         int sMax,
         int change,
         int numberOfZones)
        Initializes the fields and assigns randomly generated coordinates that are continuous and have flat areas for the landing point.
        Parameters:
        w - the width
        max - the max height
        min - the min height
        sMax - the sMax
        change - the change
        numberOfZones - the number of landing zones

    • Method Detail

      • drawLandscape

        public void drawLandscape(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the landscape using the xCoords and yCoords.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics object
        start - the X-coordinate of the starting point of where to draw the terrain
        end - the X-coordinate of the ending point of where to draw the terrain

        public void putPointValues(java.awt.Graphics g,
                  int frameNums)
        This places the point values on the GUI
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics object
        frameNums - the frame number
